segments.text: I'm looking into a kitchen scene, a line drawing really.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There's an adult woman and two children in view.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The perspective gives me a good angle of the sink and some cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It must be daytime; sunlight streams in from an open window.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is absolutely overflowing, water pouring onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not notice that growing puddle around her feet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's just calmly drying a plate, completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: My eyes are drawn to the boy on the stool; it looks so wobbly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's reaching for cookies from a jar, such a sneaky little move.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is right there, ready to receive her share.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I really hope that stool doesn't tip over with him on it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between the calm outside and the chaos inside is striking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole situation feels like an accident waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
